abstract: Chronicle focusing on 24-hour period in Dortmund, illustrates how German city handles huge refugee influx, with as many as 1,500 refugees a day in two processing areas; city re-purposes Dietrich Keuning Haus community center to buoy operations; makeshift satellite has rotating supply of 1,100 volunteers and interpreters and processes 8,000 asylum seekers in 11 days.
lead_paragraph: A reporter and a photographer for The New York Times chronicle how volunteers in Dortmund cope with a torrent of asylum seekers arriving around the clock.

headline.main: Where the Refugees Pour Into Germany, a 24-Hour Window
headline.print_headline: A German City That Has Taken In Thousands of Refugees

snippet: A reporter and a photographer for The New York Times chronicle how volunteers in Dortmund cope with a torrent of asylum seekers arriving around the clock.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
